This is important because it means that businesses need to be aware that the technology is still unproven, and therefore its risks are largely unquantifiable.
For example, businesses that use blockchain may find that the technology doesn\u2019t meet their needs. If blockchain isn\u2019t appropriate for your business and you don\u2019t have the flexibility to change course, you could suffer significant losses.
This is particularly true for large and established businesses that have significant budgets and are risk averse. While blockchain is still in its infancy and there\u2019s a lot of hype around it, it\u2019s difficult to justify the risk of using the technology.`),mdx("h2",null,"Blockchain is hard to understand and use"),mdx("p",null,`As we mentioned above, blockchain is still evolving. Each one of these has their own particular use cases and limitations. Figuring out which type is best for your business and how to use it can be a significant challenge.
Furthermore, blockchain networks are typically built using open-source software. This means that the code is freely available, but that it also lacks the stability and security that comes with commercially-built software.

This means that there is an inherent risk that someone will be able to access sensitive information.`),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"Overall, blockchain is an exciting technology that is poised to see significant growth in the coming years.
